title: Fort Larned National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Home to the Guardians of the Santa Fe Trail  Discover a complete and authentic army post from the 1860s -1870s! This well-preserved fort on the Santa Fe Trail shares a tumultuous history of the Indian Wars era. The sandstone constructed buildings sheltered troops who were known as the Guardians of the Santa Fe Trail.Â               Come picnic in the park!   Come out and help us celebrate 100 years of National Park Service history.            Check the Calendar of Events   Find out what special events are coming and how you can participate.        Check out our Education Programs   Our education programs are both educational and fun.  Check out the available options on our education page.        Corp. Herron and the Medal of Honor   Listen as Corp. Leander Herron recounts the harrowing details of the events that gained him our nation's highest military honor.
